title: 114_hr4843
content: The "Infant Plan of Safe Care Improvement Act" amends the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act to include best practices for developing plans of safe care for infants affected by substance abuse or withdrawal symptoms. The Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act is amended to ensure the safety and well-being of infants post-release from healthcare providers by addressing health and substance use disorder treatment needs and implementing monitoring systems by the State. Local entities are providing referrals and services for infants and affected families in accordance with State requirements. SEC. 4. DATA REPORTS. Amends the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act to require reporting on the number of infants identified, plans of safe care developed, and referrals made for appropriate services. SEC. 5. MONITORING AND OVERSIGHT. SEC. 5. MONITORING AND OVERSIGHT. Amends the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act to include monitoring and oversight provisions. The Secretary must monitor states receiving grants under section 106 to ensure compliance with requirements, including reviewing state policies and procedures. Monitoring may involve comparing state activities with approved plans and reviewing state website information on compliance. The Secretary monitors states for compliance with section 106 requirements, including site visits and reviewing state reports. The table of contents in the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act is amended to include this monitoring process. The Act does not authorize new requirements to be added to section 106(b) of the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act.
